ygData.subject: Invoking operations on current job (embedded)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, I m stumbling over invoking an operation on the currently running job. It s working great to embed Heritrix in another application and invoke

Hello all,
I'm stumbling over invoking an operation on the currently running job.
It's working great to embed Heritrix in another application and invoke 
methods locally just as they would be invoked by JMX --thanks for the tip 
about that, St. Ack.
An example of how I'm doing that is
embeddedHeritrix.invoke("addJob", parametersArray, null)
where the parameters array includes 1) order.xml file location, 2) name for 
the job, 3) description, 4) seed

With the currently running job, I'm using the operations from here
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/admin/CrawlJob.html#244
and I've gotten as far as getting the correct JMX object name for the 
currently running job, so I know it's not a question of the bean having 
already been unregistered.
Example of getting the object name:
embeddedHeritrix.getJmxObjectName(currentJobName, "CrawlService.Job");

Then when I try to invoke an operation, as in this pseudocode example

embeddedHeritrix.getMBeanServer().invoke(objectNameSeeAbove, 
"progressStatistics", emptyObjectArray, emptyStringArray);

I'm getting nothin'. I've tried several operations with the same result. 
Any pointers?

Thanks so much!
Shifra
